summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing Jeffrey Epstein's work release status following his plea and sentencing. It reveals that Epstein was spending his days at his lawyer's office, allegedly working for a foundation created to employ him, and expresses frustration over the situation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the emails; he is reported to be out on work release, spending days at his lawyer's office and nights at a campground, allegedly employed by the Florida Science Foundation.

persons.name: Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's lawyer; his office is where Epstein spends his days during work release, and he reportedly told the email author that Epstein would not get work release.

persons.name: Roy
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who, along with Goldberger, told the email author that Epstein would not get work release before his plea and sentencing.

persons.name: The Colonel
persons.context: Reported to the email author that Epstein has been out on work release for the past few weeks.

connections.description: Epstein is spending his work release days at Goldberger's law office, indicating Goldberger is his defense attorney.
Both are mentioned as having given the same information (that Epstein would not get work release) to the email author.

events.title: Email discussion of Epstein's work release
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys exchange emails expressing surprise and frustration that Jeffrey Epstein is out on work release, allegedly working for the Florida Science Foundation and spending days at his lawyer's office.

events.title: Epstein's plea and sentencing
events.description: Referenced as having occurred recently; before this event, Goldberger and Roy told the email author that Epstein would not get work release.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was out on work release following his plea and sentencing, contrary to what his lawyer Goldberger had reportedly stated beforehand.
During work release, Epstein spent his days at his lawyer Goldberger's office and his nights at a campground.
Epstein was allegedly employed by the 'Florida Science Foundation,' which is described as existing only to employ him and having offices conveniently located near Goldberger's office.
The email chain shows frustration and surprise among Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding Epstein's work release conditions.
